top_comments.comment: Nailed this one gentlemen. Don't really like the Schumann - bit too rich for me. Parry is the greatest Welsh composer btw... oh my goodness did he know how to write choral music... surprised there was no Grieg on the list... Wedding day at Troldhaugen. PLEASE please do another one of these... it is so important to remember those composers who spent their whole life making beautiful things that added to the richness of music... Please do another one x

comments_since_last_sample.body: Best video ive seen this month
Hi Two Set I hope you will do another kind of this video where we your twosetters can recommend you some songs that we discover.
That Debussy art song is one of my favorite songs eveerrr
Wait but isn't Mahler a really famous componist? I wouldn't say that my knowledge on classical music is really elaborate but I still know Mahler :o
Hm. Seems to me these pieces are underrated for good reason.
There are so many wonderful pieces that aren't so popular. My favorite unknown piece is "Lux Aurumque" composed by Eric Withacre

Would love to see more videos like this!! I don't know anything about classical music outside of when I was in band in junior high a million years ago, haha. I've learned so much just watching Two Set's funny videos, and this is another great window into the expansive world of classical music :)
maybe this should be a series 🤍
Kapustin is ferociously difficult.

That choral piece its very very light and heavy at the same time, its just how eddy said it was, life passing by and this is what is sing 
when dying. 10/10
Shostakovichs viola sonata, last piece he ever composed. I think it's underrated.
Me a pianist: Prokofiev 3 is overrated,  LONG LIVE PROKOFIEV 2!!!
oh god yes i played mahler 4 once and it's been one of my favourites ever since 🥺🥺
Loved this list! The Sibelius and the Schumann were great finds. The Fantaisie for Harp and Violin op 124 by Saint Saens is also an underrated piece featuring harp.
Add some Tartini - definitely underrated
All beautiful, but especially the Britten and the Parry!!! More like this please.
More please

Cantata Memoria - For The Children, by Sir Karl Jenkins from Wales 🏴󠁧󠁢󠁷󠁬󠁳󠁿
Written in memory of the 144 people who died in the Aberfan Coal Tip Disaster 50 years later, 116 of those were school children. My favourite piece from this is Lament for the Valley.
I only know the Schumann Quartet because it's my ringtone 😂 stunning piece

Nailed this one gentlemen. Don't really like the Schumann - bit too rich for me. Parry is the greatest Welsh composer btw... oh my goodness did he know how to write choral music... surprised there was no Grieg on the list... Wedding day at Troldhaugen. PLEASE please do another one of these... it is so important to remember those composers who spent their whole life making beautiful things that added to the richness of music... Please do another one x
